Reviews.Title: “A simple B&B”
Reviews.Author: LeslieNL
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean place to sleep and easy access to the tourist areas, I will highly recommend this place. The owner is friendly, helpful and speak excellent English. Although the night staff doenst speak much English, he is still extremely helpful and nice! Breakfast on the terrace on the top level has a nice view of the mamara sea. Breakfast is also prepared by a very friendly nice cheerful lady. She even baked a cake and offered it to the guests! On the down side, it is abit old and run down. if you can go pass the asethetics, this is defintely a place to stay. For this B&B, it's the charm and friendliness that shine throughout. If this place undergoes a face lift and refurbishment, I would dare say it will be hard to get a room there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllieRu
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean. Close to all major attractions. I had to move rooms all three nights when I stayed there which was lousy. If you have to buy water at the hotel, be prepared to pay 3x the amount. Breakfast was decent here. Tea was always overcooked.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: kaluvesu
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Antique Hotel over Christmas. Mustafa and his brother in law who run the little hotel were kind, friendly, well informed and hospitable. The place was very good value for money, clean and warm, and the breakfasts were substantial. The hotel is just metres away from the Blue Mosque and other attractions and to get to other places the nearby Tramway is great. We will have to return in summer when the hotel terrace is open, and we will have time to do justice to the amazing city that is Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: travelsistertoo
Reviews.Content: The budget minded traveler will be happy with the Antique Hotel. The modest rooms are clean, warm and welcoming. The substantial breakfast buffet on the enclosed rooftop deck is a wonderful way to start the day. -- The location is convenient and it is possible to walk to many of Istanbul's interesting sites. -- Enis and other staff members are extremely helpful and will do all that they can to make sure your trip to Istanbul is all that you want it to be. They will also help you plan the next step in your travels around Turkey. We began our adventure at the Antique Hotel and returned at the end of our visit to Turkey. It felt like returning home....

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, perfect ubication”
Reviews.Author: Marie S
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the most touristic area just a few meters from the blue mosc, hagia sofia and other interesting sightseeing spots, the owner was so helpful an patient to give us a lot of information. i think he is highly trustful an always objective with his recomendations. i strongly recomend him and his team. Another positive thing was that our room was cleaned every day and we had floor heating! which was very nice, espeacially for such a good price :25 euros for two people including breakfast) but: there were some things that we engoyed less. first of all the rooms are mini!!! you can hardly put your bag somewhere, between there was maybe just a distance of 50 cm!! but i also heard that in istanbul the room are often like this and sometimes you pay much more and also get a really small room. i think the room was not bigger than 10 mÂ². the bathroom was not really comfortable. there was no courtain so after taking the shower everything was wet and the shower was fossil and the toilet bowl was also not the newest and therefor it had some brown sediments... but if you just pay 5 â‚¬ more 8actually we wanted to chage the room but in the end we were to lazy to pack everything etc) you get a room with air condition, heating, and a more or less new bathroom (where you can close the shower) which i think is worth it. the breakfast in my opinion is a desaster. you don't get normal coffee but only nescafe with milk powder (sometimes they have normal milk). we went there at 9.30 (it is supposed to be served untill 10) and so many times nothing fresh was left. there iss butter, marmelade, cream cheese and some strage but tasty turkish spreads, sometimes there are tomatos, cheese and eggs, but mostly they was nothing of it left when we came. no fresh fruit, no fresh drink, only some coloured and very sweet "juices". in the end i really liked the hotel, because of the peolpe. i was happy to meet eniz (the owner) who invited us for coffe and tea when we came back late after the whole day of walking threw the cold. he offered me to bring us to the airport because he had to bring his sister there. i really would love to stay there the next time i go to istanbul because i think if you go to the 30 â‚¬ room you get a lot for that small money. the only thing is that maybe next time i don't want to stay in sultanahmet (the touristic center of istanbul) becuase it i very nice and interesting at day time, but at night it is completely dead! maybe i prefere to go somewhere where there is some more street/nightlife and go to the touristic places at daytime and take the tram or whatevere. also in sultanahmet everything is touristic!!! all the restaurants, everything! that means that it is very expensive and you will not find nice coffes (after the breakfast with horrible nescafe i couldn't find a nice place for my first good coffee, which was not absurdly expensive), bars etc. still thank you eniz for the good time. and see you next time i visit istanbul! ah, i forgot: the beds are VERY comfortable. and the terrace has a nice view!

Reviews.Title: “Come as a custumer, leave as a friend!”
Reviews.Author: Marc177
Reviews.Content: Located in Sultanahmet, in the heart of Istanbul, l'Hotel Antique is a small hotel with big capacities. The staff is very helpfull with anything a traveller may nead, directions, places to eat, visits, or do something, transportations, shuttle to airport or else, etc. It is also a great place to meet interresting travellers who have similars interests. Breakfasts, serve on the terrasse on the roof, are copious and very good and the view on the Blue MosquÃ©e on one side and the Marmara sea on the other side fills the imagination. Enis, the sympatic owner, is a valuable "personne ressource" in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Allen H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, very clean and the staff extreamly friendly. Would definiatley recommend it, and its a excellent location, in the heart of istanbul. The only comment was the the bathroom was small, and could be a little awkard at times. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Antique Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rnightingall
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located near the Blue Mosque. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast on roof with stunning views over the sea. Hotel very clean. Bedrooms rather small but quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Antique ..... :-)”
Reviews.Author: Hannari-SouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: The Antique Hotel was an amazing discovery! We received the most wonderful treatment and assistance. The rooms are small, but comfortable. The Breakfast overlooking the Bosforus was great. Cleanliness and housekeeping were both good. The staff is the biggest asset! Anyone that can handle 4 very demanding South-African woman has to be commended :-) It was a fantastic experience to have every need satisfied. My personal favourite was the outside terrace. I was surprised at the absolute spontaneous BURST OF PLEASURE I experienced as the morning prayers started...... counting the minutes waiting for sunrise...... smelling, tasting and listening to ISTANBUL :-) We will certainly return to the Antique! Hannari, Amanda, Annelet and Mari

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Customer Care...just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: onderock
Reviews.Content: I decided on Hotel Antique because of the great customer care we received from the first email I sent. I was made to feel welcome and as though I mattered and every question asked, and there were many!, was answered quickly and fully When we arrived I was so thrilled to be in the old City not the new part and the welcome we received started the vacation off perfectly. Turksih tea on the beautiful outside veranda, a variety of brochures to look at and Enis there to help decide what to do to maximise our time in the beautiful City of Istanbul. Our room overlooked the Sea of Marmaris, the bed was delightfully comfy and the breakfast eached morning was served overlooking the City as it wakes with the Blue Mosque prominently placed to be captured by eye and camera in a different light each morning,,,,just perfect The rooms at Antique are not huge but they are clean and light and fresh which is a MUST for me! The rooms at other hotels in Istanbul are not There is free Internet access and a computer in the lobby which makes email contact really easy and the outside patio is a beautiful place to relax and read in the sunshine or the shade I cant say enough good things about this hotel as the price, the location and the food are great.. BUT THE most exceptional thing is having a manager who cares about your experience, who speaks a variety of different languages and who genuinely cares about his guests....thats rare and a REALLY good reason to go to Hotel Antique... I know I will be going back as son as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: isa_isa_sa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position, is really quiet, the reception guys were great, the breakfast on the terrace with Bosforus view was great. Clearly as the price has been really cheap the room we had was little at street level,with a small bathroom (although the shower was really comfortable), but if you need it just as a place to rest after all day walking around, it's the best we could have found!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: zenobianblue
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were small but tidy and clean. The staff were very helpful and kind. Breakfast was good. The location was fabulous. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: SandraAndBill614
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in the Antique in 2006 and, yes, the rooms were small and bathrooms tiny. But, after all this is an "Antique" hotel and is to be expected. The friendliness and the breakfasts more than made up for that. Since then, we have stayed there at the beginning and end of each trip to Turkey, and found that the rooms had been upgraded almost each time we stayed. For instance, showers now have enclosures. (But, showers without curtains are common in Turkey, so invest in a cheap squeegie to dry the floors.) We've stayed in other hotels in Istanbul, but none compare for value, cleanliness, staff, and romantic setting. We've traveled all over Turkey, and the Antique's breakfast is the best. The original building was full on our last visit, so they put us in the other building. Our room there was bigger and very nice, too, but not as "romantic." Enis and his friendly staff have always bent over backwards to be helpful. We have found them to be very fair in their charges for any service.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel for All”
Reviews.Author: HaajHassan
Reviews.Content: Friendly, family run hotel in ideal location within walking distance of historical sites. Clean, comfortable and good value for money. Delicious Turkish breakfast included in price and taken on hotel's roof terrace with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arual_G
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly staff, good location. Close to the Blue Mosque and Sf. Sofia Cathedrale. Rooms are not very big.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfully with nice breakfast view from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: irishzooboy
Reviews.Content: If you don't expect too much, you wont be disappointed. Yes, the toilet was close to the shower in the room we had but that was ok. Nice terrace on the ground level to relax after trotting around the city. Nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly staff. Well kept.”
Reviews.Author: AB-CW
Reviews.Content: Antique Hotel is located a few minutes walk from the blue mosque in a quiet and well maintained tourist area. The rooms arenÂ´t the largest but reflect the reasonable price you pay to stay there. The breakfast provided is decent and provided on the roof terrace with a view of sea. The balcony room is located on the top floor (under the terrace) and we were happy with our choice to stay there. Over our stay (6 days) the room was well kept and cleanliness overall was never a problem. The staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jolle0
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very nice and reliable. The rooms are small but well equiped, very clean and very comfortable. The breakfast is really good and we take it on the roof top with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: greasy
Reviews.Content: Sifting through the abundance of budget hotels in Istanbul was certainly overwhelming. I settled on Antique Hotel as reviews were good (and other places were booked). My room was absolutely tiny. There were 2 [small] beds, but there wasn't even any floor space for my suitcase. I basically had to load up the second bed with all of my stuff. Not a problem as I was alone, but good luck if you actually want someone to sleep in the second bed (and forget about it if they are traveling with their own luggage). One of the beds was broken, so it was on an extreme slant. Once again, not really a problem for me as I had the other. I was in one of the basement rooms. This meant that outside my window I had a decent amount of noise at night/early morning. There were no real blinds, so privacy was little and the sun was very much. The bathroom was small... no problem. However, the sink was extremely leaky and soaked everything even when only running it for a second. This is a hotel, not a hostel. Prices reflect the difference. However, even elements such as breakfast were slightly sub-par. I had several friends staying at a hostel in the area. I was able to see the breakfast provided to them, and it was much more impressive, despite them paying a fraction of what I was. There were just very few options at Antique, so don't think about breakfast there if you are picky. I am not trying to be negative about this hotel. I simply think that, with the abundance of alternatives, there is no reason to settle in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Service feels (better than ;) home!”
Reviews.Author: AliceHendriks
Reviews.Content: In March 2011 we stayed 5 nights in Antique Hotel, with 5 women living in Holland, We had great time: Enis & staff were very friendly, funny ;) and professional, alwas ready with tea, coffee, a chat or a good advice. Nice cakes for breakfast too! Rooms are small, but we didn't mind because the location & service are outstanding. Alice, Banafsheh, Zahera, Faeze & Rahela

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: NoorHaliza923
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antique is located on a safe, quiet street off Kucuk Ayasofya Caddesi, hence you're guaranteed a good night's sleep after an exhausting day of exploring the city. The staff are helpful, warm and friendly and that, to me personally, gives Hotel Antique a homey atmosphere. Daily housekeeping ensures that you come back to a clean and tidy room. The hotel is located close to Istanbul's main historical attractions and it is only a few minutes' walk to the Sultanahmet tram stop. I would definitely choose Hotel Antique again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for all....”
Reviews.Author: caroie
Reviews.Content: The most I like was the silence.my first need.then the everything was very clean.and the staff very polite,and helpful.the breakfast wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lindacarolina
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the Sultanhamet district, 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque. The room was small (you could hardly walk around the bed), but very quiet and comfortable, and you could tell it had been recently renovated. Also the bathroom was nice, and clean, equipped with hair dryer and complimentary slippers. The staff didn't speak English very well, but they were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was served on the terrace in the main building (our room was in a separate building one block away), overlooking the sea. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in central istanbul”
Reviews.Author: karimzeppy
Reviews.Content: Just had a lovely 3 day break in Istanbul and have to write something about our hotel.It was friendly, cosy, clean , and in a great location, it had wi-fi and free internet , the buffet breakfast was really good and the staff were so helpful and at the price of around Â£ 35 a night per double room , i was more than happy to have stayed there....

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight in impressive city”
Reviews.Author: Sergiotti
Reviews.Content: Excellent price - quality ratio, located a stone's throw away from major attractions in Sultanahmet, Blue Mosque 200 meters. Good breakfast with a fantastic view of Bosphorus and the city, all included in the price. :-). What we will most remember is the warm casual atmosphere of this hotel. Mustafa owner is very friendly and helpful and gives great tips about 'what's hot and what's not in the city. In short, this hotel is highly recommended for those who love simple clean accommodation, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel i will definitely stay there again for my next Istanbul Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo_bb
Reviews.Content: When we get to the hotel it was very early despite we did not ask for an early check in they made their best and welcome us in our room. The rooms have standart size that a hotel can have in Sultanahmet location. The batrooms are new and very clean we really enjoyed. Closed to all historical stuctures and main destinations. Hotel staff was perfect. Thay went out of their way to help us. Even when we ask for food at the middle of the night they could bring us. Mustafa is the best hotelier I have ever met very friendly and he got well on Istanbul. All the questions are acceptable. We felt very very welcome since we start our trip for 4 nights. We thank Antique Hotel and all the staff with housekeeper because they gave one of our best travel. I definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, if you actually get to stay there”
Reviews.Author: mac094
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two separate occasions: the second was absolutely fine: the room was very small, but good value, clean and in a great location. However, on the first occasion we arrived to find that although we'd booked a twin, due to some factor I didn't understand they were proposing to put me and my companion in a double bedroom (we are good friends, but not that good!). After complaining, they did arrange for us to stay at a nearby hotel (which was actually very nice) for the same rate as we'd been quoted here....but this wasn't the point:it does just leave a bad taste in the mouth if you travel round the world only to find that a hotel tries to giove you a room you haven't booked, even if they subsequently sort out a replacement

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: bigschtroumpf
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, but really that's about it. Some of the staff people were nice, not all of them though. We had a reservation with confirmation but they hadn't booked it, so don't trust their automatic confirmation system. The rooms couldn't possibly be smaller, and the quality of the bed is close to unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Wonderful breakfast and Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: KDsTravels
Reviews.Content: My 10-year-old son and I loved Hotel Antique and recommend it wholeheartedly. The location could not be any better - right in the heart of Sultanahmet, and a five-minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome, yet very quiet and with very little car traffic. The breakfasts, which are served on the roof terrace with views of both the Blue Mosque and the sea, are very good. The staff is amiable and helped us make phone calls, wrote down directions for us, lent us an umbrella for the day and made us comfortable while we watched the World Cup each night on their lobby television. The rooms are small, but they are clean and comfortable. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gosia_112233
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely satisfied from my staying in this hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and I am looking forward to visit you again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted, and a warm welcome.”
Reviews.Author: SundriedRaisin
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a delightful 2 weeks here, celebrating 20 years together. On our budget, we couldn't have wished for a nicer place to stay. We had all the things that matter; a clean room, a very comfortable bed, efficient air-con to cool down before we slept, and as everyone else has pointed out, helpful and friendly staff, especially the excellent Enis who is a fount of wisdom on all things local. Breakfast was plentiful and varied, and most of it vegetarian-friendly. And the view from the terrace is a joy, you can contemplate the Blue Mosque one way, or watch boats drift by on the Sea of Marmara the other. Although the hotel is handy for the main old-city sights, the street itself is pretty quiet so your sleep is only interrupted by calls to prayer, and you soon get used to them. There's a tram stop a short walk away too, for going further afield. For eating later, there are many good cheap eateries in this area, our favourites were Doy Doy and Tamara, which both had veggie options. Unexpected bonuses included our own little balcony, complete with a rock dove that sat on the lamp and cooed to us in the morning. For this you need room 10 (but don't book it when we want it next). And the free car to and from Ataturk airport saved a lot of messing around - this is offered if you stay a week or more. What might put you off? The room was small, and sparsely furnished. Our bathroom was tiny, and although mostly there was plenty of hot water, occasionally it vanished completely. Enis was very apologetic and hopefully will get this sorted out. The spiral steps are a bit steep, if you're not very mobile this might be a problem. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MabsLondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little smalll but it is an excellent base for exploring the old part of Istanbul. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Nice having breakfast up on the roof looking out over the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Small homely Antique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitjajevnikar
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms are small but greet, a very cordial stuff and a the abundant breakfast is on a nice terrace .I think thet the price is good for the location!

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: ajmasseur
Reviews.Content: Enis( owner) and the other staff members are almost like a family.With their sincere approach, I never felt homesick. I stayed in Hotel Antique for 4 months.Always clean,always friendly,tidy... I you guys want to feel the Old Istanbul Texture , Both Hotel & the Location IS the place. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Antique is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: canary09
Reviews.Content: This was a first trip to Istanbul. The Antique was a home away from home. Enis and Erkon were warm hosts who felt like friends. Where else could you stay and be serenaded with a violin or share a visit on the patio? The room was small and spare but just right for the cost. We looked forward to the breakfast, especially the french toast, in the rooftop breakfast room each morning which looked out onto the blue mosque and the Marmara Sea. Showers were hot, the internet was available, the rooms were clean, the location was quiet but just blocks from major sites, and the airport shuttle was efficient. We look forward to going to Istanbul again and staying at the Antique. This hotel was a lucky find!

Reviews.Title: “good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: butterflyTurkey
Reviews.Content: If you are not planning to walk all day in the fantastic region of Sultanahmet instead of staying in the hotel room, this hotel is the perfect choice. It has a very good location in the quitest part of Sultanahmet and good price for the rooms. The roof floor being used for breakfast has a very nice view. The staff is very kind. Breakfast is alright. The only problem with the room is the bathroom. As the WC is very close to the shower area and the shower has no curtain, WC and floor of bathroom are always wet after taking shower

Reviews.Title: “Love to visit again”
Reviews.Author: kaya_ali
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and in Antique Hotel. Very friendly staff, stunning location, lovely breakfast and a beautiful view from the little breakfast lounge. The only one negative experience was the cigarette smell in the rooms. Otherwise the hotel was clean enough for a short stay. We stood 4 nigths and had at the beginning our doubts. But except the fact if somebody smokes downstairs you get the same smell in your room as well, we enjoyed out vacation and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, and staff”
Reviews.Author: Spiral13
Reviews.Content: As with most others who will be reading this, I'm sure you'll have read the other reviews that I scoured through before making my decision on a hotel in Istanbul. I'll perhaps address a few of the other readers concerns that I came across along with my personal opinion of Hotel Antique: -Location was amazing - literally a 3 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, couldn't ask for anything better -Service was incredible - the owners were extremely helpful in all requests and inquiries, transportation to and from the airport was organized as well which was a huge help. The breakfast provided was great and the atmosphere/view overlooking the sea from the terrace was breathtaking. -Somewhat small rooms - yes, the rooms were small in comparison to more commercial hotels, but if you're looking for character and a more unique experience Hotel Antique was perfect. -Some previous readers were concerned with the fact that the breakfast wasn't in the same building as their room? Yes - there were two separate locations with rooms...however they were all of a 10 second walk between each other. No different from walking the length of a larger hotel...except it was better since it was outside! So this should not even be considered a factor in my mind - if you're that upset that you have to walk outside for 15 seconds, I'm not sure what you're doing traveling in the first place. -No elevators - correct, there are no elevators and the stairwell is relatively narrow. If you have limited mobility or trouble with stairs this probably isn't the place for you -My only real concern was that the walls were paper thin. It wasn't the other guests that were making noise, but one of the nights I was staying, what sounded like a massive party going on nearby outside was occurring, and was very noisy and disruptive while i was trying to sleep. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for others, especially considering the price, location, breakfast, and service from the owners. While it isn't the newest of buildings with slightly undersized rooms, I was more than satisfied with my stay at Hotel Antique and hopefully if/when I return, chances are I'll be heading back here!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for small money!”
Reviews.Author: Trabzon61
Reviews.Content: The rooms of this hotel are small, but for the price it is more than just good !!! Very friendly staff... helpful 24hours a day! Also, nice terrace with a beautiful view, where we enjoyed our daily ( very tasty ) breakfast ! For people, who are looking for a place closed to every sightseeing and don't wanna pay a lot of money... is this hotel the right place! We enjoyed all our days in Istanbul and the Antique Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and people”
Reviews.Author: mistereq
Reviews.Content: We stayed Ä±n antÄ±que hotel for 7 days - Ä° can only say that it's clean and situated in the heart of old Ä°stambul. People are great and helpfull - hope that we'll have a chance to visit this place again.

Reviews.Title: “missing refund”
Reviews.Author: zyxg
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 6 to 10 august 2009. The building was not that one in the picture. Another one 50 metres away. During the second night at three a thief entered the room from the window and stole only a mobile phone because i woke up. Otherwise he would have stolen more. So the following nights we slept with window closed and air conditioning. Outside a nice 20 degree with wind. When back to Italy i asked the hotel for a refund, twice by email but they never replied. They replied to our requests before the stay. I will not suggest this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great position ... excellent breakfast, small rooms, could be cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: teus72
Reviews.Content: Briefly : I slept there only for one night. It's right behind the Blue Mosque, so in the very center of the city but rooms are quite small and not exactly tidy.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and comfortable venue, at very good value”
Reviews.Author: Azazia
Reviews.Content: Although this was not an easy place to find (definitely advisable to get a map before you land in Istanbul, and NB the street runs for ever!), once we'd got here we had a really pleasant stay. With a buffet breakfast and towels provided, we really felt this was good value at Â£15 a night. That's not to say it's a five star venue - aside from the free internet access, access to a kitchen (in their second building) and rooftop terrace, it could be described as pretty basic. But for our low-budget trip, the fact that it was clean with a private bathroom and had friendly staff ticked all the right boxes. Oh, and it's location is pretty outstanding too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: JenEricTravelers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location and rate. Our rooms were not available upon arrival, we were offered tea and coffee and wait for our room. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We were housed in the 2nd building around the corner. Our room (corner room, 2 windows) was very nice and comfortable (as was the bed) There are NO LIFTS in this hotel - all spiral stairways. There were 2-English news channels, a wardrobe, bed sidetables. Something you might not have seen before- toilet was in the shower. OK- dont be worried, it all works, just more closely than you have seen before. Dont let that deter your choosing this hotel. Conveniently located near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia - 5 min walk. Breakfast consisted of breads, olives, cucumbers/tomatoes, cheese, and coffee/juice served on a terrace overlooking the Bosporus/Sea of Marmara.

Reviews.Title: “An all round winner”
Reviews.Author: martiflat
Reviews.Content: To find such a good value option in the prized Sultanahmet area of Istanbul was a surprise and this small pension did not disappoint beyond price and location. The staff were just as you would hope (but not often find in a city hotel) - friendly and informative without being intrusive. The rooms are basic but very clean (serviced every day with fresh towels etc) and Room 7 was a decent size although the bathrooms was compact (typical Turkish style with hand held shower). Breakfast (or evening sundowner) on the small terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus was a real bonus - you could easily pay three times as much to secure such a view. Ideally located (albeit in a rather shabby side street) as it is a short stroll to the main square and there are lots of restaurants in the streets around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elenakat
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive at first as could not find any reviews on this hotel, however when we arrived we were very pleased with our room and the welcome from the staff there. Our room, no.10 had a small balcony which overlooked a quiet street and houses across the street with friendly neighbours who gave us a wave. The room was basic but very clean with comfortable beds and soft duvets. Small clean newly tiled bathroom but always had hot water and fairly good pressure shower. We had looked at a few other hotels and hostels and found this to be much the best value for Istanbul. The breakfast was the typical Turkish breakfast with olives, tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, bread, warm boiled eggs, little sponge cakes and these lovely cheese filo pastry rolls. It was a buffet so you could select what you preferred and help yourself to juice and tea or coffee. Breakfast was served in the upstairs roof terrace which had super views of the sea and of the Blue Mosque. As mentioned the staff were so helpful, they were very genuine and we felt very welcome. They had free internet and a balcony we could use which got sun most of the day, ideal place to relax in the afternoon after a busy day shopping at the Grand Baazar! Location was perfect as we were close to all major sights, only 5mins walk to Blue Mosque. I will definitely stay here again when I next visit Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: Antique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Caddesi | Ogul Sok No. 17 Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
